entry.title: Combined summary - Is Signet Bitcoin?
entry.summary: Currently, there is a problem with the reliability of Testnet which is used in the development of Bitcoin. To improve the development environment for Bitcoin, a proposal has been made to create a new kind of testnet named Signet that is more reliable than Testnet. However, there is some debate about whether Signet should be considered a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) and why Testnet is considered Bitcoin while Signet is not. This is because both are not entirely compatible with the mainnet consensus processes. A pull request has been made to add Signet to the BIPs repository, but it has stalled as the maintainer is uncertain about whether Signet should have a BIP at all. There is an argument for Signet's inclusion in BIPs that it is indeed Bitcoin and having a BIP would facilitate interoperability between different software in the Bitcoin space. However, others argue that Signet is not Bitcoin but rather "interoperability for how to build good testing for Bitcoin." Feedback on the issue is welcome on the pull request itself or on the bitcoin-dev mailing list.Jon is interested in hearing the logic behind the distinctions between Testnet and Signet and why Testnet is considered Bitcoin while Signet is not.
